thin.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
thin.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She’s only wearing a thin summer jacket  (=a jacket made of light material).
The road was covered with a thin layer of ice.
The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
Keep your voice down – the walls are paper thin.
thin.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: having little fat on your body
as thin as a rake/rail/whippet  (=very thin)
thin.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He was tall and thin, with short brown hair.
Most high school girls say they want to be thinner.
thin.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if someone has thin hair, they do not have a lot of hair
thin.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: His hair is quite thin on top.
thin.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a liquid that is thin flows very easily because it has a lot of water in it
thin.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: smoke or mist that is thin is easy to see through
thin.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The fog is quite thin in places.
thin.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: air that is thin is more difficult to breathe than usual because it has less oxygen in it
thin.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: the thinner air high in the mountains
thin.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a thin excuse, argument, or evidence is not good or detailed enough to be useful or effective
thin.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Evidence that capital punishment deters crime is pretty thin.
thin.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a thin smile does not seem very happy or sincere
thin.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Charlie gave her a thin smile.
thin.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: a thin voice or sound is high and unpleasant to listen to
thin.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: having little fat on your body
a slim woman in her fifties
Magazines are always full of advice about how to stay slim.
thin in an attractive and graceful way – used especially about parts of the body, and used especially about women
She is slender, with very fair hair.
thin and looking healthy and fit
He was lean and looked like a runner.
very thin in a way that is not attractive
a small, slight girl with big eyes
a scrawny kid in blue jeans
below the usual weight for someone of your height, and therefore too thin
He had no appetite and remained underweight.
very thin and pale, especially because of illness or continued worry
He looked gaunt and had not shaved for days.
extremely thin and weak, because you are ill or not getting enough to eat
The tents were filled with emaciated refugees.
used about someone who is so thin that you can see the shape of their bones
The soldiers were shocked by the skeletal figures of the camp’s prisoners.
used about someone who is extremely thin because they have a mental illness that makes them stop eating
thin, especially in a way that looks attractive
tall or long and thin, in a way that looks attractive, but is often not very strong
the slender columns that supported the roof
The spider was hanging by a slender thread.
The walls of the apartment were paper-thin.
thin.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to become fewer in number, especially when there were many before, or to remove people, plants, or things so that fewer remain
thin.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The crowd had thinned out and only a few people were left.
The trees thinned as we got closer to the top of the mountain.
Thin the carrots to two inches apart.
Her hair had been thinned and cut shorter.
thin.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make something thinner or to become thinner
thin.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The clouds had begun to thin.
A narrow smile thinned his lips.
thin.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid
thin.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Thin the sauce by adding milk.
The pastels can be thinned with water.
thin.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: if someone’s hair is thinning, they have less hair than they used to
thin.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: a tall man with thinning hair
thin.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: thinly. Many teachers think this is not correct English
thin.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Don’t cut the bread so thin.
thin.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if trading on a financial market is thin, there is not much activity
thin.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Trade was thin in the currency markets yesterday, heading into a Japanese long weekend.
